message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ST, cs.IT, cs.SY

The paper proposes a novel algorithm for Thompson sampling that is efficient even when the prior is non-conjugate. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper involves optimization techniques and the Gumbel-Max trick, which are commonly used in the sub-categories of statistics (cs.ST) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper also mentions best arm identification, which is a problem commonly studied in the sub-category of control systems (cs.SY). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG and cs.AI, followed by cs.ST, cs.IT, and cs.SY.
